name: Natural gas, production mixture, at extraction
description: This unit process combines the U.S. natural gas production sources based on their percentage share in the U.S. natural gas mix. The mix is made up of onshore conventional, offshore conventional, associated natural gas, Barnett Shale, Marcellus Shale, and coalbed methane natural gas. The process is for 1kg of natural gas to consumer. The natural gas mix is based on 2014 data from US Energy Information Administration (EIA).
category: 21: Mining, Quarrying, and Oil and Gas Extraction/2111: Oil and Gas Extraction

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This process is representative of the 2014 aggregate natural gas production mix based on percentages from EIA, 2017.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process is representative of the U.S. natural gas production mix.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Natural gas extraction by percentage source including conventional extraction and unconventional extraction methods. Conventional natural gas is extracted using vertical well bores and using minimal stimulation. Unconventional natural gas extraction is used where permeability and porosity are so low that extraction requires a horizontal well bore followed by multistage hydraulic fracturing. Natural gas extraction is characterized by six types of extraction, namely onshore conventional, offshore conventional, associated natural gas, Barnett Shale, Marcellus Shale, and coalbed methane natural gas.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: Attributional; Data sets for the six natural gas extraction sources were linked to represent the U.S. natural gas mix. Compatible with TRACI.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: Secondary data were used to determine the U.S. mix of natural gas.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: Elementary flows are cut-off at less than 1% based on environmental relevance.
TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE DATA: Miscellaneous materials and additives, capital equipment, facilities and infrastructure, space conditioning, and support personnel requirements are not included in this system process. No gaps have been identified in this dataset.
MASS BALANCE: The mass balance was calculated by a straight comparison of inputs and outputs
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: The natural gas mix is based on 2014 data from US Energy Information Administration (EIA).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset was used to model the aggregate natural gas extraction production mix process based on percentages from EIA, 2017.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
BOUNDARY CONDITIONS
The system boundary includes upstream burdens from incoming natural gas extraction sources and represents a consolidation of six extraction sources into one production mix. The following are excluded from the unit process boundary: miscellaneous materials and additives, capital equipment, facilities and infrastructure, space conditioning, and support personnel requirements.

DATA COLLECTION
Secondary data were collected from EIA, 2023.

UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATION
No uncertainty analysis was carried out due to the lack of uncertainty data or probability distributions for key parameters, which are often only available as single point estimates from NETL.

reviews.details: Internal review of data entry proofreading, mass balance verification and data documentation.

reviewers.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

processDocumentation.intendedApplication: Situation C1 - Accounting, with system-external interactions - The intended application is a purely descriptive accounting / documentation of the analysed system including existing interactions with other systems in the LCI model. These data are an update to a previously published dataset which is a generic unit process model. A full inventory of environmental flows are included; thus this unit process can be used for a full range of LCIA impact categories. The target audience of this model includes LCA practitioners, industry, and the general public. For use as an average dataset accepted by the North American plastics/chemical industry. An inventory of environmental emission flows are included to the extent that the producers provided; thus this unit process can be used for a full range of LCIA impact categories. The original study results were analyzed using the TRACI LCIA factors.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This project was funded by NAPCOR and is currently in progress. These data are an update to a previously published dataset which is a generic unit process data.

dataGenerator.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
